intro: Wendlandia longifolia, commonly known as the long-flowered bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the branches. Wendlandia longifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant, long-lasting blooms.
